did.unittitle: North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives 1850-2008 and undated bulk 1898-2008
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the North Carolina Central University or Duke University online library catalogs.
did.abstract: Oldest currently active African American-owned insurance company in the United States, founded in 1898 and headquartered in Durham, North Carolina.

The North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives documents the development of N.C. Mutual in Durham, N.C., and contributes to the historic record on African American businesses and entrepreneurship in the South and in the United States. Dating from 1850 to 2008, with the majority of the items dating from 1898-2008, the material covers nearly every aspect of N.C. Mutual's operations, management, and milestones. Documents take the form of corporate office files, including the offices of five company presidents; annual statements; reports; surveys; memos; legal and financial papers; original life insurance policies; training material; programs; ephemera and artifacts; and a large number of historical photographs of staff and their families, offices, buildings, and Durham scenes. Significant businessmen represented in the papers include founders John Merrick and Aaron Moore; and presidents Bert Collins, Joseph Goodloe, William Kennedy Jr., William Kennedy, III, Charles C. Spaulding, Asa T. Spaulding, and current president James H. Speed. The collection is especially rich in print material, including many issues of three company publications: The Mutual (1903-1929), The Whetstone (1924-1998), and The Weekly Review (1925-1998). It is also notable for its assemblage of material on United States African American history, and public relations material dating from the earliest years to present times, including advertising ephemera, advertising campaigns, and other related items. Other materials document NCM's outreach to the African American community throughout its history to counter racism, unemployment, and diseases by means of public health programs, church affiliations, mentoring, and scholarship programs. Over one hundred selected digitized photographs and a few documents are also available online. Acquired and curated jointly by the North Carolina Central University's University Archives, Records and History Center and the John Hope Franklin Research Center for African and African American History and Culture at Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Files in the Office of the President Subseries are restricted for 25 years from the last year of each presidency. Permission to access these records must be granted by NC Mutual in writing prior to use. Otherwise, contents are open to research. Personnel files found in this series have been separated and are closed for 75 years from the date of creation of the latest material, currently 2074.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Some use copies are available in the collection. Otherwise, Technical Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.

Please contact staff in the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University, or in the University Archives, Records and History Center, North Carolina Central University, before coming to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University or North Carolina Central University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The records in the North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives document the history of the oldest currently active African American insurance company in the United States. The material dates from 1850 to 2008, with the majority of the items dating from 1898-2008, and covers nearly all aspects concerning the operation, management, and milestones of NC Mutual (NCM). Documents include but are not limited to corporate office files, including the offices of five company presidents; annual statements, reports, surveys, and memos; legal and financial files; original life insurance policies and other documents; advertising, internal and external publications, pamphlets, posters, and other print material; training material; many historic photographs; public relations and outreach material; memorabilia; and audiovisual recordings. The majority of the collection concerns the company's home office in Durham, N.C., although there is a significant amount of material that also relates to NCM district offices located throughout the United States, particularly in Southern states, as well as records that refer to other related organizations such as insurance companies and financial institutions.

Broadly speaking, the collection contributes significantly to documentation on the history of African American businesses in the United States, particularly in the South, and on the socioeconomic status of African Americans in the South in the 20th century. Also present in the collection is valuable information on public health issues affecting 20th-century African Americans and public health programming created by NC Mutual as well as other agencies. In addition, through company records and many ephemeral publications such as obituaries, the collection also documents in detail the work status and personal lives of the company's many employees and their life insurance customers, predominantly African American women and men.

The collection is rich in print material, including many issues of three company publications--The Mutual (1903-1929), The Whetstone (1924-1998), and The Weekly Review (1925-1998). It is also notable for its assemblage of public relations material dating from the earliest years to present times, including advertising ephemera, material related to advertising campaigns, and other items. Additionally, there are records of NCM's extensive community outreach such as public health, mentoring, and scholarship programs, and documents relating to the company's ties with Durham's churches such as White Rock Baptist, and with other organizations such as Mechanics and Farmers Bank.

Corporate office files form the bulk of the collection, covering nearly every aspect of the company's operations and activities from its founding in 1898. There are extensive correspondence files as well as meeting notes and minutes, many legal and financial reports, and surveys of the insurance industry. Materials relating to a published history of NCM written by one of its presidents, William Kennedy Jr., are located in the Office of the Presidents Series. Company presidents represented most substantially in the files include: William Kennedy Jr. (1952-1958), Asa T. Spaulding (1959-1967), Joseph Goodloe (1968-1972), William Kennedy III (1972-1990), and Bert Collins (1990-2003). Earlier and later presidents and leaders, including founders Merrick and Moore, and presidents C.C. Spaulding and James Speed are also represented in smaller amounts of material. Personnel records are also present and are closed to use until 2074, 75 years after the date of most recent record.

Several thousand photographs preserved in the collection date from the earliest years of the company and offer important and vivid historical evidence concerning NCM's history, its employees and their families, and the history of Durham, N.C. The collection also contains photographs of founders Merrick and Moore and their families, NC Mutual office buildings throughout its history, and many large photographic portraits of senior administration from the earliest years to the most current. Other photos capture employees either in company photographs or at banquets and conventions throughout the company's history. From these photographs and other images not represented in the collection, NCM created an exhibit space named "Heritage Hall" in its home office devoted to the commemoration and preservation of the company's history; the exhibit images and texts, framed or mounted on board, are also preserved in the NC Mutual Archives.

Acquired and curated jointly by the North Carolina Central University's University Archives, Records, and History Center, and the John Hope Franklin Research Center for African and African American History and Culture at Duke University.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the following series, described more fully in this inventory: Corporate History Files (2 boxes), Company Offices (83 boxes), Digital Media (3 boxes), Exhibit Materials (25 boxes), Memorabilia and Artifacts (14 boxes), Other Organizations (9 boxes), Photographic Materials (23 boxes), Printed Materials (51 boxes), Recordings (24 boxes), Social Groups and Events (1 box), and Scrapbooks (6 boxes). There is a large Oversize Material section (over 50 flat boxes and larger oversize folders) containing material from almost all series; listings are generally after each relevant series.

The Company Offices Series comprises records from selected offices: Actuary, Agency, Auditing, Controller, Corporate Planning, Executive Committee, Facilities, Medical Department, Office of the President (the largest subseries), Public Relations, and Personnel Files (closed to access). These subseries are described further in this collection guide.

did.unittitle: Company Offices Series, 1850, 1898-2008 and undated, bulk 1920-2000

scopecontent.p: Arranged in the following subseries named after North Carolina Mutual departments and offices: Actuary, Agency in Force, Auditing, Controller, Corporate Planning, Executive Committee, Facilities, Medical Department, Office of the President, Public Relations, and Personnel Files (closed). There is also an oversize section at the end of each subseries or smaller subgrouping. The Office of the President Series holds the records from the following presidents: William J. Kennedy, Jr., Asa T. Spaulding, Sr., Joseph W. Goodloe, William J. Kennedy, III, and Bert Collins. Company office functions and spaces are also represented in other formats in the Exhibits, Photographic Material, Memorabilia and Artifacts, and Recordings Series.

accessrestrict.p: [The material in the Office of the President is restricted for 25 years from the date of the end of the presidency in question, unless written permission is granted by North Carolina Mutual. The Personnel Files subgrouping is closed to public access for 75 years from date of creation of the most recent record, or 2074.]

did.unittitle: Actuary Office Subseries, 1952, 1969, 1974-2001 and undated, bulk 1980-1987

scopecontent.p: The records relate to the Actuary Office's responsibilities of risk assessment in life insurance, investments, pensions, and other company activities and policies. Organized into two categories: Reports for the Board of Directors and Executive Committee, and Actuary Files. Actuary files include memos and consultants' studies and plans. The bulk of the material was created in the 1980s.

Agency in Force Office Subseries, 1850, 1920-1994 and undated

scopecontent.p: The center of company operations, the Agency in Force Office handles all company sales of policies, and is staffed by agents in the field, their supervisors, district managers, and home office representatives. By 1948, the company already had over 1,000 agents in force throughout the South. The material of this subseries includes Executive Committee directives and decisions, agency-related files and ledger books, and the G.W. Cox papers. The Agency files contain salary information, several issues of The Weekly Review, memos, and manuals. The subseries also contains policy loan certificates and claims dismissal correspondence with the Receiver from Woodmen Union Life Insurance Company.

A blank life insurance policy on a slave printed by this same company also exists in the Charles Hunter Papers in the Rubenstein Library at Duke.

scopecontent.p: The Office of the Controller is in charge of coordinating, planning, and reporting on financial activities, including bookkeeping, accounting, and financial reporting. The material in this subseries consists of the Report of the Controller to the Board of Directors for NCM, ranging from 1986-2001. Also contains annual reports, annual statements, and Bonds and Stocks Owned statements.

accessrestrict.p: [Some of the materials in this box are fragile and in need of preservation. Please contact a reference archivist to use this material, as contents should be photocopied before being handled.]

scopecontent.p: Contains detailed materials on the research, planning, execution, and progress of the construction of the new Mutual Plaza home office, including blueprints for the home office and the Chatham annex. Also includes plans for organizational and management restructuring, business plans by company department, reports, manuals for the functions and duties of home office organization, reviews of data processing, and correspondence with management consulting firms and other companies. Additionally contains alphabetized files regarding general correspondence, solicitation, and donation requests. Includes information regarding Murray Marvin (one of the directors of Corporate Planning) during his time at both Jackson Mutual and NC Mutual. Note: The structure of the Corporate Planning department changed several times over the course of NC Mutual's history. Corporate Planning and Public Relations merged under Murray Marvin in 1967 and was reorganized into Planning and Communications around 1976.

did.unittitle: Executive Committee Subseries, 1922-2003 and undated, bulk from 1972-1989 [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.p: Mainly pertains to business conducted by the Executive Committee, a standing committee of the Board of Directors, which is made up of a minimum of five Directors, at least one of which is required to be an outside Director. Material from the Salary Committee, another standing committee of the Board, is also included in this subseries. The Salary Committee consists of five of the Directors, one of whom must be the President of the company.

accessrestrict.p: [Subseries is restricted for 25 years from date of last created folder, or 2028; until that date, written permission must be given by donor before contents can be accessed.]

scopecontent.p: Materials include a history of the department, which was established by Dr. A.T. Moore in 1916 and disbanded after 2002, as well as print material produced for health campaigns, and biographical information on directors Dr. Charles D. Watts and Dr. John T. Daniel. Arranged in alphabetical order by folder title. Other archival records and memorabilia on medical topics and health campaigns can be found in the Printed Material, Publicity, and Memorabilia Series.

Office of the President Subseries, 1903-2002 and undated, bulk from 1950s-1990s [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material from the offices and files of five of NCM's nine presidents: William J. Kennedy, Jr., Asa T. Spaulding, Sr., Joseph W. Goodloe, William J. Kennedy, III, and Bert Collins. The contents relate mainly to the periods during which these presidents held the office, though in some cases there is material from previous positions they held within NCM and apart from the company. Much of the material includes files relating to the execution of company business, correspondence, and personnel matters. The majority of the material in the subseries originates from the offices of Kennedy, III and Collins.

accessrestrict.p: [Files in the Office of the President Subseries are restricted for 25 years from the last year of each presidency. Permission to access these records must be granted by NC Mutual in writing prior to use. Otherwise, contents are open to research. Personnel files found in this series have been separated and are closed for 75 years from the date of creation of material, or 2074.]

scopecontent.p: Served as President of NC Mutual from 1952-1958. Much of the contents of this subseries comprises the materials that Kennedy, Jr. used to document the history of North Carolina Mutual, as well as the wide variety of historical sketches he produced. Other material in this subseries relates to general company business from his tenure at NCM both as the Corporate Secretary and as President, including a letter of support for Pauli Murray's admission to the New York State Bar Association in 1948. Additionally, there is material relating to his tenure as the President of the Bankers Fire and Casualty Insurance Company.

scopecontent.p: The bulk of the material dates from the 1980s and consists of bids, invoices, contracts, shipping lists, and correspondence regarding advertising in specific periodicals, radio stations, and television stations. Also included are memos, drafts, sketches, and research regarding advertising strategy, specific advertisements, and promotional events. This subseries also contains clippings, sample ads, and promotional materials, such as calendars and pamphlets, and photographic plates of group shots and advertisements. Other promotional items are housed and described in the Memorabilia and Artifacts Series.

scopecontent.p: Documents NCM's various programs and activities related to community outreach through scholarship support, mentoring programs for youth, and community health programs such as anti-smoking campaigns. Materials consist of event programs, pamphlets, clippings, speeches, photographs, certificates, and leaflets. A substantial portion of the materials are related to the Merrick-Moore Scholarship in the 1930s, including lists of colleges and students, bills, receipts, and correspondence from awardees. Also of note are materials related to the Avery Boys' Club, including a binder belonging to W.J. Kennedy, Jr. Other programs and events are related to the United Negro College Fund, NCCU, the Boy Scouts, Greater Durham Arts Fund, a letter from President Reagan, the 1943 launch of the S.S. Merrick, and Founders' Day celebrations.

The bulk of the material is related to specific events, such as annual meetings, the ground-breaking ceremony in 1963, and the celebration of NCM's 85th anniversary, centennial, material for tribute honoring Dr. William and Stella Cleland, script material for television episode regarding N.C. Mutual and John Merrick, and various Founders' Days. Materials consist of slides, photographs, clippings, correspondence, programs, print materials, memos, and other planning documents. Also included are historic NCM policies and certificates.

scopecontent.p: Files of mixed correspondence concerning the Public Relations Department. The bulk of the files date from 1984-1986. Materials also include solicitations, brochures, and subscription forms. Topics include radio and television stations, interview requests, A.T. Spaulding, Ben Ruffin, and W.J. Kennedy, Jr.

Additional materials created by the Public Relations Department that do not fit in above categories. Topics include office contests, employee benefits, taxation, the donations committee, smoking cessation program files, the new products committee, the lyrics to the company song, and the history of African Methodism. Materials include phone messages, personnel forms, notes, agenda, minutes, memoranda, brochures, correspondence, an architecture showcase book, a drawing of a house, information collected regarding Hispanics, and a memoir about life insurance.

Files open to research access contain company publicity regarding personnel, including, but not limited to, obituaries, biographies, a list of employee birthdays, and other announcements. Among those profiled are Asa T. Spaulding, C.C. Spaulding, Jr., William Henry Harvey, W.E. Williams, W.E. Coleman, W.D. Hill, J.L. Wheeler, W. Lionel Cook, and Fred R. Moore. Several folders related to the retirement and death of William Kennedy, Jr. contain extensive photographs alongside paper materials. Folders profiling women associated with NCM contain copies of The Whetstone and photographs from the 2000s.

scopecontent.p: Assembled by staff of NC Mutual and a former company archivist, these files contain a sampling of the most significant historical documents illustrating the formation of the company, its founders, and its first decade of existence. Materials are varied and include charters and by-laws; early policies, publications and advertisements; significant correspondence; programs, annual statements, and Christmas greetings; items marking milestones in company history; and other unique items. There is also a folder with two charts for 1933 and 1941 ranking the current African American owned life insurance companies, including NCM. Other historical and early items can also be found throughout the collection, especially in the Agency, Memorabilia, Photographic Material, and Print Material Series, and the Office of the President Subseries; early examples of policies from 1902 into the 1930s are found in the Agency Series. Arranged in rough chronological order.

scopecontent.p: Houses the components of many exhibits assembled and curated by North Carolina Mutual staff. Mostly consists of black and white or sepia images and captions mounted on thin board, often with velcro backing, which originally formed a large installation in "Heritage Hall" gallery commemorating NCM's history. Other exhibits were created for specific events such as conventions. Most of the images were reproduced from vintage photographs from the early years of the company, many of the original photographs can be found in the Photographic Material Series. Others show officers and employees from throughout NCM's history. Includes color and black and white photographs, signs, labels, and informational panels. Also includes two framed letters of interest: one from Eleanor Roosevelt's secretary, writing in July 1934 subsequent to a visit to NCM by Roosevelt in June of that year, and the other a strongly worded letter written by President Spaulding on improving the company's performance, entitled "Open Letter to Managers," from Berlin, Germany, 1931.

Many thousands of additional images are housed in the Photographic Materials Series, including original photographs from which the exhibit images were reproduced. Some exhibit materials are in this series as well.

did.unittitle: Lincoln National Life Foundation, Inc. Subseries, 1973-1975

scopecontent.p: Created to administer the Lincoln National Life Museum, the Foundation provided an avenue for charitable, tax-exempt contributions of Lincoln memorabilia to the museum. It appears that the NCM Corporate Planning department requested information from the Lincoln National Life Foundation regarding its annual report and bylaws in 1975.

Founded in 1929 by C.C. Spaulding, E.R. Merrick, and R.L. McDougald to provide greater financial independence for black businesses in Durham, N.C. Although this company stood as a separate corporate entity from NCM, many of the members of the Executive Committee were leaders at NCM, and the company was somewhat connected with NCM in practice. The material consists of the early minutes of the Executive Committee of the Mortgage Company of Durham.

scopecontent.p: Established in 1921 as the National Negro Insurance Association (later renamed National Insurance Association or NIA), and was created in order to promote and represent the mutual interests of insurance companies that were owned and operated by African Americans. C.C. Spaulding was elected as the first president of the association and NCM has remained one of the largest member companies of the organization to the present. NCM employees have regularly served on the Board of Directors and as officers for the NIA.

scopecontent.p: The thousands of photographs in this series document the history of North Carolina Mutual Insurance through images of its employees and their families, buildings and other places, and company events. The images range from formal portraits and group shots to snapshots taken at banquets, conventions, meetings, on trips, and around the office. There are many 19th century photographs of NCM leaders and their families, staff, including women workers, the earliest home office buildings, office interiors, and community events. Individuals depicted in later images include NCM officers, employees, their families, and prominent figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King, Jr., Spiro Agnew, Jesse Jackson, ambassadors, and other politicians. Many significant original images were reproduced by NCM in various sizes and for various purposes; some of these reappear in the Exhibits Series material. The bulk of the 20th century images were produced by the Public Relations Department for The Whetstone and The Pilot and are therefore often marked for cropping and resizing. Although some images are captioned with names, years, and locations, many are unmarked and many dates have been estimated. Some related paper material, such as clippings, biographical sketches, speeches, copies of publications, and memos transmitting the images, can also be found with the prints.

Materials are arranged into subseries by medium, but there are also slides, negatives, and negative reproductions found with corresponding photographs in the Prints Subseries. Comprising the bulk of the series, the Prints Subseries is arranged into Events, Historic Images, Other Public Relations, People, and Places Subseries. However, many of the images in these subseries overlap. Related items are also found in the Exhibit Material Series.

Large-format photographs and albums are located in the Oversize Prints section listed at the end of this series. These items include historic images of the company's early offices, portraits of senior administrators, group shots at banquets and other events, and images of the NCM home office buildings. Sizes range from 11x14" to approx. 32x40", as well as a very large panoramic print of the early home office on Parrish Street, 27x75" (closed to use until conservation treatment is completed).

Contains negatives and negative reproductions stored separately from prints. Items are arranged in loose chronological order and then into broad categories by content. Negatives directly associated with prints are located in the Prints Subseries.

Mostly produced by the Public Relations department for publications such as The Whetstone and The Pilot, the prints are arranged into Events, Historic Images, Other Public Relations, People, and Places subseries, and within, chronologically. Negatives and slides directly associated with prints and related paper material are also located in this subseries. Many other large-format images are found in the Oversize Prints subseries listed at the end of the series.

Arranged chronologically, these images depict banquets, conventions, trips, and meetings hosted or attended by NCM staff. Most but not all were labeled. Significant events include annual meetings of the National Insurance Association, a 1964 speech by Robert F. Kennedy, a 1964 trip to Mexico and Central America, and the celebration of NCM's 85th anniversary in 1983. Other events include awards ceremonies, retirement celebrations, the Annual Policy Holders' Meeting, Founders' Day, enrollment drives, and charitable events, such as an AIDS Walk and blood drives. Prominent event titles are included. Individuals depicted include NCM officers, employees, their families, politicians, and figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Spiro Agnew, Jesse Jackson, and the Nigerian ambassador to the U.S. Some negatives and related paper documents are also included.

scopecontent.p: Contains early black-and-white images of officers, employees, their family members, corporate meetings, the NCM office, and groups related to NCM, such as Thrift Clubs, musical groups, and sports teams. Other historic images can also be found in the People Subseries. Large-format historical images of the NCM offices and its officers and employees are also found in the Oversize Prints section at the end of this series; sizes range from 11x14" to approx. 32x40"; there is also an extremely large panoramic print 27x75" of the Parrish Street home office, closed to use until conservation treatment is completed. Arranged by content in loose chronological order.

scopecontent.p: Collection of 132 black-and-white photographs ranging in size from approx. 3x4" to 8x10", with three predominant types of images appearing in this order: the exterior of the home office on Parrish Street in Durham; interiors from the 1920s-1940s, including many early departments and their staff and equipment; and portraits of officers and other staff. Many of the subjects are identified on the back of the print. A series of commercially-made images of the medical and other departments in the 1940s are particularly of note. A few image slots are empty (#16, 134-137).

Arranged in loose chronological order, subseries contains intermixed images, almost all black-and-white, of events, people, and places, produced by the Public Relations Department for exhibits and publications such as The Whetstone and The Pilot. Some folders are related to specific issues of publications or composite pages while others are more intermixed. Many of the images in this subseries overlap with other subseries. Those depicted include NCM officers, employees, their families, policy holders, politicians, and prominent figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King, Jr., and Jesse Jackson. Some negatives, reprints of older images, clippings, and related paper materials are also included. The bulk of the material dates from the 1960s.
Contains reprints of photographs and drawings from different periods in NCM history, compiled for exhibits in the 1980-2000 period.

scopecontent.p: Primarily contains images of the North Carolina Mutual physical plant, including different office buildings, men and women staff members on the job, workspaces, equipment, mainframes, decorations for specific events, and the construction of the 1965 home office. Includes photographic images of the original office buildings from circa 1900 to an architect's rendering of the new home office, circa 1963. Other images of the home offices can be found in oversize photo boxes and in the exhibits series. Of particular interest are a series of images of NCM employees' homes, which are labelled with the employee's name, rank, and city. Also included are scenes in Durham, N.C. and snapshots from business trips to Puerto Rico and Miami.

scopecontent.p: Arranged into the following subseries: NCM Publications, Non-NCM Publications, and Periodical Clippings. The first two subseries are further subdivided into two large format groupings: Pamphlets and Other Publications, and Serials. These files were assembled by NCM staff, and offer a rich array of material on African American history, culture, and businesses. Formats include essays, reports, pamphlets, brochures, fliers, newsletters, newspapers, journals, popular serials, internal publications, promotional literature, and obituaries. The substantial clippings file was assembled by the Public Relations Department, and is arranged topically; there are significant amounts of materials on the civil rights movement.

There are also oversize sections at the end of each subseries, chiefly housing newspapers and other serials; early issues of Durham newspapers can be found here, as well as issues of mainstream magazines such as Ebony. The Non-NCM subseries in addition contains a large sub-grouping of print items related to Durham's historically black North Carolina Central University, including campus newspapers and events programs. Subseries and their contents are fully described below.

Various publications issued by North Carolina Mutual, including programs from memorial services; publications commemorating company anniversaries and the opening of new offices; The Mutual Album (a booklet containing photographs and biographies of NCM's founders and early employees); Education in our Democracy (a reprint of a speech that W.J. Kennedy, Jr. gave at Fort Valley State College); The Negro's Adventures in the Field of Life Insurance and Partners in Business (instructional tracts written by W.J. Kennedy, Jr. and Asa T. Spaulding, respectively); and various sales, promotional, and recruitment material, and training manuals. Arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

Includes a large collection of material related to African American history; a number of government publications (primarily concerning either the African American population or the state of the economy); files from a 1973 audit of NCM conducted by the firm Ernst and Ernst; brochures and booklets related to health education; and publications produced by the NAACP, the National Urban League, the Southern Regional Council, the National Insurance Association, the Institute of Life Insurance, Ebony, the United Negro College Fund, the National Council of Negro Women, and the Peace Corps, among many others. scopecontent.p: Series houses sound and moving image recordings spanning many decades and documenting milestones in North Carolina Mutual History. Formats include audiocassettes, audio tape reels, film reels, and videocassettes.
Audiocassettes are few in number and include a set of home-study tapes on insurance practices.

Subjects of films include a history of North Carolina Mutual; the history of "Black Wall Street" in Durham; the groundbreaking and dedication ceremonies for the current headquarters building on Chapel Hill Street in Durham; and advertisements and broadcasts about NC Mutual products and services. Titles of films listed have been taken from original canister or box labels. Many of these films were copied in digital format to DVD, around 2002 (see listings of digitized moving images in Digital Material Series).

scopecontent.p: Varying in size and condition, these scrapbooks commemorate the history of North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance through clippings, photographs, memos, programs, and other items. Also found in the photographic material section in the Oversize Material Series are photo albums that also commemorate company personnel, conferences and other events, and milestones.

accessrestrict.p: [Scrapbooks are fragile; some are slated for further preservation treatment. Please contact a reference archivist before coming to use this material.]

scopecontent.p: Commemorating the dedication of new home office building, this scrapbook chiefly contains many pages of congratulatory messages in the form of letters and telegrams, many from notable officials, politicians, and businessmen.
History of NC Mutual from its beginnings to the 1970s. Almost completely made up of cut-outs from the company publication Whetstone.
Contains newspaper clippings of NCM advertisements, along with a photograph, clippings of competitor's ads, and an event program. Approximately 25" x 17".

Eighteen-page portfolio (approximately 13" x 16") belonging to calligrapher and illustrator Walter W. Micheaux. Micheaux was recognized as an expert penman and, after moving from South Carolina. in 1916, illustrated and hand-lettered the insurance policies, publicity, logos, and other material for NCM for over 20 years. Scrapbook contains many original examples of his work, as well as a 1928 clipping about him (with photo), and a small photo of him as an older man.

accessrestrict.p: [Extremely fragile. Slated for conservation treatment. Please consult with a reference archivist before using.]

scopecontent.p: The majority of the contents of this scrapbook are dedicated to the launching of the S.S. Merrick in honor of John Merrick on July 11, 1943. Also includes a specially-bound edition of the Whetstone edition honoring NCM's 50th anniversary, as well as various newspaper clippings relating to individuals and other entities connected to NCM. Other items laid in to the scrapbook are copies of a letter and photo from President John F. Kennedy, a 1946 Whetstone honoring John Merrick, and an unidentified Atlantic City vacation photograph of NC Mutual staff, circa 1940s.
Scrapbook of newspaper clippings belonging to J.L. Wheeler, NCM Agency Director of the Southern Region.

scopecontent.p: Files relate to social clubs and events for North Carolina Mutual employees. The groups that are chronicled in these files include the NCM Glee Club and the Tuesday Morning Study Group, a self-improvement group composed chiefly of the wives of NCM administrators that met to read about and discuss political, social and cultural topics of the day. Materials on the latter make up the majority of these items.
